intro: Lopezia parvula, commonly known as the small Lopezia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its small, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces clusters of tiny, pale yellow to greenish flowers that bloom in late spring. Lopezia parvula typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in desert ecosystems.
